issues.title: MCQ templates are fragile
issues.content:
[[type]]
multi
[[attribs]]
Contributor: Kevin Dunn
Difficulty: 2
Tags: least squares, linear model
Grade: 2
[[question]]
Check all options that *correctly apply*:

A least squares model, \(y_i = b_0 + b_1 x_i + e_i\), shows signs of non-constant error variance:

--
& The model coefficients \(b_0\) and \(b_1\) will not be calculated correctly.
^ Confidence intervals for \(\beta_0\) and \(\beta_1\) will be wider than they would otherwise be.
^ The problem may be reduced by using weighted least squares instead.
^ The problem is detected when plotting the residuals against the predicted \(y\)-values.
& Is problematic, because it means the residuals are not normally distributed.
[[Solution]]
The above works


[[type]]
multi
[[attribs]]
Contributor: Kevin Dunn
Difficulty: 2
Tags: least squares, linear model
Grade: 2
[[question]]
Check all options that *correctly apply*:

A least squares model, \(y_i = b_0 + b_1 x_i + e_i\), shows signs of non-constant error variance:

--
& The model coefficients \(b_0\) and \(b_1\) will not be calculated correctly.
^ Confidence intervals for \(\beta_0\) and \(\beta_1\) will be wider than they would otherwise be.
^ The problem may be reduced by using weighted least squares instead.
^ The problem is detected when plotting the residuals against the predicted \(y\)-values.
& Is problematic, because it means the residuals are not normally distributed.

[[Solution]]
Leaving an extra line above Solution causes bad checkbox placement

issues.title: Do not allow new answers to be saved after the final time has expired.
issues.content: Enforce this at the model .save() level, because the user can manipulate the "disabled" styling of the <input> element (e.g. via the browser's DOM inspector) and cause the answer to changed after the test cut-off.

issues.title: Deregister a student from the course
issues.content:
* Is an email still sent to them (e.g. they deregister midway)
* They should still be able to sign in and check their existing quests
* They should not be added to new quests (i.e. QActuals not generated for them)

issues.title: Case sensitivity denoted
issues.content:
For "short" answer questions, allow instructor to specify if the solution is case sensitive (for text answers), or not.

This prevents instructors having to set permutations for all sorts of case-insensitive answers.

issues.title: Significant figures
issues.content: Have clarity on what is deemed to few or too many sig figs, and what level of tolerance you will accept.

issues.title: Export questions (and answers) to PDF
issues.content: After the time limit, students can export the questions to PDF.

issues.title: Enable feedback
issues.content: If ``enable_feedback`` is True, then show and handle the student feedback.

issues.title: No solution displayed
issues.content: Have an option so that the solution is not displayed after the cut-off time.

issues.title: "Saved" fade in/out like Google does in gmail.
issues.content: "saving" -> "saved"

issues.title: For MCQ: option to avoid rearranging choices
issues.content: should be available in the template script

issues.title: Image resizing
issues.content: If image resizing is required, then apply it, else leave it to be small (else large images get blown up)

issues.title: Do not allow precision of "0" in quick_eval
issues.content:
e.g. you might be tempted to specify an integer as

 ["[{% quick_eval \"0.001035003*N\" 0 %},1E-6,'rel']"]

but the correct rounding for an integer is

 ["[{% quick_eval \"0.001035003*N\" 1 %},1E-6,'rel']"]

issues.content: on the right hand side

issues.title: Comment out WING DEBUG
issues.content:
I use this one in my Django settings for every project
  DEBUG = bool(int(os.environ.get('DJANGO_DEBUG', 0)))
and all my working environment define DJANGO_DEBUG=1.  This means things
like runserver/shell (any management command) runs in debug mode, but
production runs automatically default to DEBUG=False

For wingdbstub, you can something like this:

if os.environ["WING_DEBUG"]
  import wingdbstub
endif
